label: OK: balancing school and soccer
text: I’m doing okay overall, just stressed about balancing my classes with joining the soccer club.

label: OK: new city, some nerves
text: I moved to a new city for work and I feel a bit nervous meeting new people, but I’m also kind of excited.

label: OK: busy but supported at work
text: Work has been busy this week, but my manager is supportive and I feel like I can handle it.

label: OK: mild procrastination
text: I keep procrastinating on small tasks and it annoys me, but I eventually get everything done.

label: OK: wants better habits
text: I feel generally okay, I just want to build better daily habits and be more consistent.

label: Caution: homesick and ghosted
text: I just moved to the US for my masters. At first I made a few friends, but now they barely reply and I feel really homesick and left out.

label: Caution: doomscrolling and isolation
text: Yesterday I stayed in my room all day just scrolling on my phone. I wanted to text people, but I felt like a burden.

label: Caution: small improvement but lonely nights
text: Today was slightly better, I talked to one classmate after class, but nights still feel really lonely.

label: Caution: social anxiety about party
text: I was invited to a party this weekend and I want to go, but I’m anxious I’ll just stand in a corner and not know what to say.

label: Caution: roommate conflict
text: My roommate and I keep snapping at each other about chores. It stresses me out but I don’t feel unsafe or anything like that.

label: Caution: flat and going through motions
text: For months I’ve felt kind of flat and unmotivated. I still go to class and do my work, but nothing feels meaningful.

label: Caution: friends think I’m fine, internal numbness
text: My friends think I’m fine, but inside I feel like I’m just going through the motions and not really present.

label: Caution: body image worries
text: Lately I’ve been really upset about how I look. I don’t starve myself, but I keep comparing my body to others and I feel gross.

label: Caution: stress eating
text: When I’m stressed I end up eating a lot of junk food and then feel guilty afterward, but I’m still functioning day to day.

label: Caution: relationship conflict, no safety concern
text: My partner and I have been arguing a lot lately and I’m scared they might leave, but I don’t feel in danger or anything like that.

label: Caution: family tension
text: There’s been so much tension at home. My parents keep arguing and I feel stuck in the middle, constantly on edge.

label: Caution: low motivation but still functioning
text: Lately it’s been hard to get started on anything. I still meet deadlines, but it feels like I’m dragging myself through every task.

label: Caution: panic spells but coping
text: Sometimes I get waves of panic where my heart races and I feel dizzy, but I’ve been using breathing exercises and it eventually passes.

label: Caution: past self-harm, currently stable
text: A few years ago I hurt myself once during a really bad time, but I’m working with a therapist now and I don’t have those thoughts right now.

label: Caution: self-criticism, no self-harm
text: I keep calling myself a failure in my head, even though I’m not doing terribly. I don’t want to hurt myself, I just feel really hard on myself.

label: High: alcohol, fear but no self-harm intent
text: Lately I’ve been drinking way more than I usually do. I’m not trying to hurt myself, but I feel out of control and scared.

label: High: blackout and risky situation
text: Last night I blacked out again and I don’t even remember how I got home. I hate that I keep putting myself in risky situations like that.

label: High: mixing substances once, now scared
text: I mixed alcohol with some pills at a party recently. Nothing serious happened, but afterwards I got really scared thinking about what could have gone wrong.

label: High: daily weed use affecting focus
text: I’ve been smoking weed almost every night and now I can’t focus in class or remember things clearly, but I still keep doing it.

label: High: can’t get out of bed some days
text: Some days I just stay in bed and skip class because everything feels heavy. I don’t want to end my life, but I’m really struggling to function.

label: High: severe insomnia and impairment
text: For weeks I’ve only been sleeping a couple of hours a night. My brain feels foggy and I’m making mistakes at work and school.

label: High: skipping meals frequently
text: I keep skipping meals because I feel disgusted with my body. Sometimes I get dizzy, but I still push myself not to eat much.

label: High: past self-harm, intrusive thoughts, no intent
text: Last year I hurt myself a couple of times. Now the thoughts pop up once in a while, but I don’t want to act on them and I haven’t made a plan.

label: High: passive wish not to wake up, strong protective factor
text: Sometimes I think it would be easier if I just didn’t wake up, but I would never act on it and I would reach out for help if those thoughts got stronger.

label: High: chronic pain and hopelessness, no stated self-harm
text: My chronic pain has been so bad lately that I feel hopeless about things ever improving, even though I’m not trying to hurt myself.

label: Crisis: explicit suicidal ideation, imagining ways
text: Tonight it’s worse. I keep thinking about ending my life and imagining different ways I could do it.

label: Crisis: has plan to take pills tonight
text: I feel done with everything and I’ve been thinking about taking a lot of pills tonight so I don’t wake up.

label: Crisis: goodbye letters
text: I wrote goodbye messages to my friends and family because I don’t think I’ll be around much longer.

label: Crisis: sitting with means, no future
text: I’m sitting here staring at a bottle of pills and I honestly don’t see any future for myself anymore.

label: Crisis: conditional but serious threat
text: If this exam goes badly I swear I’m going to end my life because I can’t handle failing again.

label: Crisis: doesn’t want to be alive anymore
text: I don’t want to be alive anymore and I keep thinking that everyone would be better off without me here.

label: Crisis: focused on jumping
text: I can’t stop thinking about ending everything by jumping, and it feels like the only way out of this pain.

label: Crisis: recent self-harm attempt, current urges
text: I tried to seriously hurt myself last week and now the urge to do it again is getting stronger.

label: Crisis: internal commands to self-harm
text: I keep hearing thoughts in my head telling me to end it, over and over, and it’s scaring me.

label: Crisis: detailed plan about where and when
text: I’ve picked a specific day and place where I plan to end my life and I don’t see a reason to stop.
